707586f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 36th St.
707586f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, from E. 36th (left) to 37th (right)
Streets. The four tenements at the left will be raxed in June,
9oining those that surrounded same. At the right margin appears
a portion of the Eleto Go. wawehouse which occupies the entire lower
end of the 38th -39th Street block.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

WOrkmen are occupied On the former site nf St.
Gabriel's Whurch and School.
A.cross same appear buildings at 37th Street
i(left of center) and First avOnue (right of center).
The snoke stacks above the former, are atop the
Consolidatec Edison Co. plant on First Avenue.
1Iote at the left margin the New York Public Library

712277f-b.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712277f-b.text:
East 36th Street, west from First avenue, showing
the cleared area extending 1 block souare and which will
provide an extance to the new l.idtown - Gueens Tunnel.
Standing alone is the New York Public Library Branch.
This will come down in early 1940. The tenements at the
right line the north side of East 37th Street.
Forming a backdrop are skyscrapers, which from left
to right (collective views) are, the Empire State, the
10 East 4Oth Strect, the New York Trust, the Lefcourt
Colonial, the 5O( Fifth Avenue, the Lincoln, the Chanin
and the Cnrysler Buildings.
View 1: June 28, 1939
Views 2-3:  July 23, 1939
P.  . Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

707585f-a.text:
First Avenue, at the N. W. corner of East 36th Street,
and westward to show the open area inclosing the entr-
ance to the Mid4own-2ueens Tunnel. The buildings on
the right face on the north side of East 37th Street.
In the background is Second Avenue, with its elevated
line thereupon. Skyscrapers of the 42nd Street-Trand
Central zone dominate the skyline.
September 21, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
NO REIPODUCTIONS

707588f.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 36th St. E.
707588f.text:
First Avenue, west side, from E. 3oth (left) to 37th Streets,
showirg the M.idtown Queens CCunnel clearance extending to Second
Avenue (''El'' thereupon). In solitary dignity stands the St.
Gabriel's branch of the New York Public Library. This is shortly
to come down. Note St. Gabriel's Park at the left and the Empire
State Building in the buckground.
Sept 20, 1939
Nathan Schwartz
New Aork Public Library
M.Y BE REPROuuCED

712282f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712282f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, north side, west from (No. 325, right) a
point midway between First and Second Avenue and to the latter
(left). Shown are St. Gabriel's Parochial School, its Hall and the
New York Publio Library branch building. To the right are two
tenements bearing No's 323 and 325. All of these face the upper
end of St. Gabriel's Park and will be found missing in June 1939,
having been demolished (exclusive of the Library building/ for
the approach to the 38th Street tunnel.
January 12, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority
CREDIT LINE IPERATIVE

712284f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712284f-a.text:
East 3eth St: eet, north side, between First and
Second Avenues, showing the cieared forner site of St.
Gabriel's Church and Parocaial School. To the left and not
shown is tne still standing New York Public Library brauch.
The 'El'' line in the midground is on Second Avenue.
To the right are tenements on the north side of 37th Street,
slightly east of tne Avenue. The N.E. corner there is cleared
also, the samme has no connection with tne tunnel project.
Centered in the uistwnce is the spred Chrysler
Building, flanked by tne Gnanin and News structures.
View 1: June 28, 1939
Views 2-3: July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPR( DUCTIOS

First and Second Avenues, shnowing a northerly view of the
partially cemolished St. Gabriel's Ron.an Catholic Church.
Tnis edifice faces on the south side of 37th Street,
slightly east of Second Avenue. An entire block is
being razed for tne plaza approach to the Midtown-Tueenns

712283f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712283f-a.text:
East 36th Street, north side, west fror a point midway
between First and Second avenues, and across the latter, to
show St, Gabriels Parochial School under demolition.
The Church of this name is to the rear, facing on the
south side of East 37th Street, and is in the same condition.
The three story Hall adjoins the School and will shortly
follow. To the west is the New York Public Library branch
building identified with this Church. This will remain
standing until early 1940 when this will be razed also.
View No. 3 is photographed from St. Gabriels Park and
shows the shadowy outlines of the Chrysler and Lincoln Build-
ings across the School and Library respectively.
No. 1 May 25, 1939
2 May 26, 1939
L. Sperr  3 May 27, 1939
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707581f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 36th St. E.
707581f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, south from E. 36th Street.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIV

712278f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712278f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, west from Pirst Avenue, showing the clearance
extending between 36th and 37th Streets. Thru this area will run
the iidtown Queens Tunnel. Standing alone to the left is the
St. Gabriel's branch of the New York Public Library. This soon
will be demolished. In the right background are skyscrapers
forming the Fifth Avenue-42nd Street outline.
Sept. 20, 1939
Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library
MAY BE REPRO.UCED

712283f-b.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712283f-b.text:
East 36th Street, north side, west fror a point midway
between First and Second avenues, and across the latter, to
show St, Gabriels Parochial School under demolition.
The Church of this name is to the rear, facing on the
south side of East 37th Street, and is in the same condition.
The three story Hall adjoins the School and will shortly
follow. To the west is the New York Public Library branch
building identified with this Church. This will remain
standing until early 1940 when this will be razed also.
View No. 3 is photographed from St. Gabriels Park and
shows the shadowy outlines of the Chrysler and Lincoln Build-
ings across the School and Library respectively.
No. 1 May 25, 1939
2 May 26, 1939
L. Sperr  3 May 27, 1939
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712292f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712292f-a.text:
345-335 East 36th Street, north side, west of First Avenue, f
St. Gabriel's Park.
June 6, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712275f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712275f-a.text:
East 36th Street, west of First Avenue, as photographed across
the avenue and St. Gabriels Park. This entire block is to be cleared
for the Midtown-lueens Tunnel approach. Note on the rirht a part
of this activity already under way. St. Cabriels Church ard Paro-
chial School were included. Forming a backdrop are the skyscrapers
oonstituting the Grand Central-42nd Street outline. From left to
right respectively, these are, the Chanin, R. C. A., Chrysler, News,
Waldorf-Astoria and General Electric Buildings. The Tudor City Hotel
Woodstock is on the right.
1939
Alexander Alland
NO REPRODUCTI11S
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume
''Portrait of N. Y.'' by Fwlix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

707583f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 36th St. E.
707583f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, south from E. 36th Street, showing
St Gabriel's Park awtending between same and 35th Street. Buildings
appearing across same are on the south sice of E. 35th Street, west
of the Avenue. To the right is the rear of the 12 story Harriet
Hubbard Ayer Building, No 317-23 E. 34th Street (1.v.). See
ame for general views of this area.
January 7, 1939
Sorrach Fhoto SerVice
New York City Tunnel Nuthority

712293f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712293f-a.text:
337-9-41 E. 36th Street, north side, west of First Avenue,
showing three tenements that will be demolished (May 1939) for
the construction of the approach of the 38th Street tunnel under
the East River. These face the lower end of St. Gabriel's Park,
where the photographer is standing.
January 12, 1939
